thread.title: New Powerball Rules Boost Odds, Prizes
thread.title_full: New Powerball Rules Boost Odds, Prizes

author: hdmoadmin
title: New Powerball Rules Boost Odds, Prizes
text:
New Powerball Rules Boost Odds, Prizes 
Arkansas News Bureau 
LITTLE ROCK â€” Changes to the Powerball rules that take effect Sunday will give players a better overall chance of winning a prize and boost some prize amounts, Arkansas lottery officials said Thursday. 
Under the new rules, players will choose their first five numbers from a set of 69 white balls instead of the current 59 and will choose the Powerball from a set of 26 red balls instead of the current 35, which will improve the overall odds of winning a prize from 1 in 31.8 to 1 in 24.9, according to a release from the Arkansas Scholarship Lottery. 
Tickets will still be $2, jackpots will still start at $40 million, and the prize for matching the five white balls but missing the Powerball will still be $1 million. However, the third-highest prize, which is won by matching four white balls and the Powerball, will increase from $10,000 to $50,000. 
Also changing is the Power Play option, which currently allows most prizes to be multiplied up to five times for an extra $1 per ticket. 
Under the new rules, when the jackpot is $150 million or less, the Power Play option will multiply most prizes by two, three four, five or 10 times. When the jackpot is above $150 million, the highest multiplier will be five. 
Power Play does not apply to jackpots. The prize for matching the five white balls but not the Powerball will continue to double to $2 million if a player chooses the Power Play option. 
Powerball drawings will continue to be held at 9:59 p.m. on Wednesdays and Saturdays.
